content:
198
DEPOSIT OF THE DOCUMENTS ON THE PROCLAMATION OF A WILL
(1) The minutes of the proclamation of a will in the case of an original written will or a document attesting to a nuncupative will, or the minutes of the examination of the witnesses to a nuncupative will, shall be sent to the probate court; the court that has proclaimed the will shall keep a copy of the above.
(2) The original written will, a document attesting to a nuncupative will, the minutes of the examination of the witnesses to a nuncupative will or the minutes of the content of a missing or destroyed written will shall be deposited at court separately from other files, whilst a certified copy thereof shall be added to the files.
